title: 2018 Scottish Cup Final
text:
The 2018 Scottish Cup Final was the 133rd final of the <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a> and the final of the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Scottish%20Cup">2017–18 Scottish Cup</a>, the most prestigious knockout <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition in Scotland. The match took place at <a href="Hampden%20Park">Hampden Park</a> on 19 May 2018 and was contested by <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a> and <a href="Motherwell%20F.C.">Motherwell</a>.
The fixture was a repeat of the finals in <a href="1931%20Scottish%20Cup%20Final">1931</a>, <a href="1933%20Scottish%20Cup%20Final">1933</a>, <a href="1951%20Scottish%20Cup%20Final">1951</a> and <a href="2011%20Scottish%20Cup%20Final">2011</a>, all of which were won by Celtic. It was also a repeat of the <a href="Scottish%20League%20Cup">League Cup</a> final earlier in the <a href="2017%20Scottish%20League%20Cup%20Final">same season</a>, which Celtic won 2–0.
Celtic completed a successive domestic <a href="Treble%20%28association%20football%29">treble</a> ("double treble"), a feat which had not previously been achieved in Scottish football.
Match.
Summary.
<a href="Callum%20McGregor">Callum McGregor</a> opened the scoring for Celtic after 11 minutes with a right foot half volley from the edge of the penalty area into the left corner of the net after the ball broke to him. 
<a href="Olivier%20Ntcham">Olivier Ntcham</a> made it 2-0 after 25 minutes with a low right foot finish to the left corner of the net after a pass from <a href="Moussa%20Demb%C3%A9l%C3%A9%20%28French%20footballer%29">Moussa Dembélé</a>.
Details.
Match rules
